Package Recursion

Class RecursionAnalysis

java.lang.Object
Recursion.RecursionAnalysis
public class RecursionAnalysis
extends java.lang.Object
A java class to analyze the efficiency of different recursion limits along with different array sizes. The output of this program can then be converted to Excel format enabling us to print tables.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    RecursionAnalysis()  

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void analyzeQSLimit​(int size)
    Analyzes different array sizes and recursion limits for the quicksort(QS) algorithm.
    void CSV_PRINT​(java.util.ArrayList arr, java.lang.String title)
    Takes in an array as a parameter and prints it in CSV format.
    static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
    Tests the RescursionAnalysis with multiple array sizes ranging from 20,000 to 10,020,000.

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Constructor Details

    • RecursionAnalysis

      public RecursionAnalysis()

  • Method Details

    • analyzeQSLimit

      public void analyzeQSLimit​(int size)
      Analyzes different array sizes and recursion limits for the quicksort(QS) algorithm. Prints a comma seperated list of time values corresponding to the recursion limits and array sizes.
      Parameters:
      size - the size of the array

    • CSV_PRINT

      public void CSV_PRINT​(java.util.ArrayList arr, java.lang.String title)
      Takes in an array as a parameter and prints it in CSV format.
      Parameters:
      arr - list to be printed.
      title - descriptive title for list being printed before the list

    • main

      public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
      Tests the RescursionAnalysis with multiple array sizes ranging from 20,000 to 10,020,000.
